title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1996/88 of 4 July 1988 re-establishing the levying of customs duties on umbrellas falling within CN code 6601, originating in Singapore, to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 3635/87 apply
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1996/88
of 4 July 1988
re-establishing the levying of customs duties on umbrellas falling within CN code 6601, originating in Singapore, to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 3635/87 apply
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
As from 10 July 1988, the levying of customs duties, suspended pursuant to Regulation (EEC) No 3635/87 shall be re-established on imports into the Community of the following products originating in Singapore:
1.2.3 //  //  //  // Order No  // CN code   // Description  //  //  //  // 10.0700   // 6601   // Umbrellas and sun umbrellas, (including walking-stick umbrellas, garden umbrellas and similar umbrellas)   //    //   //

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 4 July 1988.
For the Commission
COCKFIELD
Vice-President
(1) OJ No L 350, 12. 12. 1987, p. 1.
